input2:
There was a 70% lesion just distal to the stent. Successful PTCA of the LCX), moderate sCHF with LVEF of 35%-40% on echo, moderate PA systolic hypertension, paroxysmal atrial fibrillation (not currently on coumadin), who presents with chest pain x 1 hour.  
.  
Of note, patient is a poor historian, but notes chest pain at rest that lasted for perhaps 60 minutes. It radiated down both arms and was not associated with other symptoms. He reported PND, orthopnea, and increased edema in the ED. He is not on a diuretic.
input3:
+ CAD with stable angina, s/p CABG, multiple stents 
+ Moderate pulmonary artery systolic hypertension - TR gradient   
+ Hemoperitoneum around the liver and in the pelvis along with two splenic artery pseudoaneurysms s/p embolization of both.
+ when taken off vanco, has frequent diarrhea and dehydration
+ HTN
+ Hyperlipidemia
+ Anemia
+ Prostate CA s/p XRT
+ s/p discectomy
+ Left hip arthroplasty
+ Severe osteoarthritis
﻿

VS: afebrile, HR 53, BP 104/62, RR 22, 100% 4L NC  
GENERAL: NAD. Oriented to name and location as BI, unsure of year and president. Mood, affect appropriate.  
HEENT: NCAT. Sclera anicteric. PERRL, EOMI. Conjunctiva were pink, no pallor or cyanosis of the oral mucosa. No xanthalesma.  
﻿
NECK: Supple with JVP of 8 cm.  
CARDIAC: PMI located in intercostal space, midclavicular line. Irregular rhythm, bradycardic, normal S1, S2. No m/r/g. No thrills, lifts. No S3 or S4.  
LUNGS: Unlabored. Crackles at bases and dullness to percussion bilaterally  
ABDOMEN: Soft, NTND. No HSM or tenderness. Abd aorta not enlarged by palpation. No abdominial bruits.  
EXTREMITIES: 2+ pitting edema bilaterally. Redness without warmth.  
SKIN: No ulcers, scars, or xanthomas.  
PULSES:  
Right: Carotid 2+ Femoral 2+ Popliteal 2+ DP
Left: Carotid 2+ Femoral 2+ Popliteal 2+ DP
